Articles.Content: alright lets get this mod into full swing!

2 things,

have you asked frizzank about the fairings?

I will be making a Phoenix replica using stock,FASA gemini LR and the ARNE engine mod.

ill report back when I'm done.
What about the classics like

The phoenix makes sense from a gameplay and modeling standpoint, Gameplay wise it's symmetrically equal, so it will be easier to fly, and it's designed from the ground up to be launched by an ICBM/Rocket. Modeling wise it's also the smallest of any startrek model that's been considered so far, so less work, also has a little bit of animation but not alot.....

Also it's just author's choice, Please note I don't speak for him, I just remember him deciding to do the phoenix to get started......

What about the classics like

-snip-

of course the sovern class is my fav and the enterprise i DO have planned! (all cannon and the new enterprise)

The phoenix makes sense from a gameplay and modeling standpoint, Gameplay wise it's symmetrically equal, so it will be easier to fly, and it's designed from the ground up to be launched by an ICBM/Rocket. Modeling wise it's also the smallest of any startrek model that's been considered so far, so less work, also has a little bit of animation but not alot.....

Also it's just author's choice, Please note I don't speak for him, I just remember him deciding to do the phoenix to get started......

yes that is why i'm starting with the phoenix because its smaller and less detailed. so i think its a good starting point
It also has a center of thrust behind it's center of mass, so it would not barrel-roll like the other ships.

It also has a center of thrust behind it's center of mass, so it would not barrel-roll like the other ships.

you mean flip?? as i said i was going to balance the ship

plug in?? what plug in??

The Puffin Plugin- It is supposed to handle radiation of heat, from engines in space, and handle solar heating, as well as the frame-shift engine effects and possibly a VASMIR engine's function.

pic time!!
